operations.CreateStreamingURL: Creates a URL to start an AppStream 2.0 streaming session for a user. By default, the URL is valid only for 1 minute from the time that it is generated.
operations.DeleteStack: Deletes the stack. After this operation completes, the environment can no longer be activated, and any reservations made for the stack are released.
operations.DescribeFleets: If fleet names are provided, this operation describes the specified fleets; otherwise, all the fleets in the account are described.
operations.DescribeImages: Describes the images. If a list of names is not provided, all images in your account are returned. This operation does not return a paginated result.
operations.DescribeSessions: Describes the streaming sessions for a stack and a fleet. If a user ID is provided, this operation returns streaming sessions for only that user. Pass this value for the nextToken parameter in a subsequent call to this operation to retrieve the next set of items.
operations.DescribeStacks: If stack names are not provided, this operation describes the specified stacks; otherwise, all stacks in the account are described. Pass the nextToken value in a subsequent call to this operation to retrieve the next set of items.
operations.ExpireSession: This operation immediately stops a streaming session.
operations.ListAssociatedFleets: Lists all fleets associated with the stack.
operations.ListAssociatedStacks: Lists all stacks to which the specified fleet is associated.
operations.UpdateFleet: Updates an existing fleet. All the attributes except the fleet name can be updated in the STOPPED state. Only ComputeCapacity and ImageName can be updated in any other state.
operations.UpdateStack: Updates the specified fields in the stack with the specified name.

Application.base: An entry for a single application in the application catalog.

refs.Image$BaseImageArn: The source image ARN from which this image was created.

refs.Application$Enabled: An application can be disabled after image creation if there is a problem.
refs.UpdateFleetRequest$DeleteVpcConfig: Delete the VPC association for the specified fleet.

refs.CreateFleetRequest$ComputeCapacity: The parameters for the capacity allocated to the fleet.
refs.UpdateFleetRequest$ComputeCapacity: The parameters for the capacity allocated to the fleet.

CreateFleetRequest.base: Contains the parameters for the new fleet to create.

refs.CreateStackRequest$Description: The description displayed to end users on the AppStream 2.0 portal.
refs.UpdateFleetRequest$Description: The description displayed to end users on the AppStream 2.0 portal.
refs.UpdateStackRequest$Description: The description displayed to end users on the AppStream 2.0 portal.

refs.CreateStackRequest$DisplayName: The name displayed to end users on the AppStream 2.0 portal.
refs.UpdateFleetRequest$DisplayName: The name displayed to end users on the AppStream 2.0 portal.
refs.UpdateStackRequest$DisplayName: The name displayed to end users on the AppStream 2.0 portal.

refs.FleetError$ErrorCode: The error code for the fleet error.

refs.Fleet$FleetErrors: The list of fleet errors is appended to this list.

Image.base: New streaming instances are booted from images. The image stores the application catalog and is connected to fleets.

refs.Image$State: The image starts in the PENDING state, and then moves to AVAILABLE if image creation succeeds and FAILED if image creation has failed.

ImageStateChangeReason.base: The reason why the last state change occurred.

refs.Image$StateChangeReason: The reason why the last state change occurred.

refs.ImageStateChangeReason$Code: The state change reason code of the image.

refs.ComputeCapacityStatus$Running: The total number of simultaneous streaming instances that are running.
refs.ComputeCapacityStatus$InUse: The number of instances that are being used for streaming.
refs.ComputeCapacityStatus$Available: The number of currently available instances that can be used to stream sessions.
refs.CreateFleetRequest$MaxUserDurationInSeco: The maximum time up to which a streaming session can run.
refs.CreateFleetRequest$DisconnectTimeoutInSe: The time after disconnection when a session is considered to have ended. If a user who got disconnected reconnects within this timeout interval, the user is connected back to his/her previous session.
refs.DescribeSessionsRequest$Limit: The size of each page of results. The default value is 20 and the maximum supported value is 50.
refs.Fleet$MaxUserDurationInSeconds: The maximum time during which a streaming session can run.
refs.Fleet$DisconnectTimeoutInSeconds: The time after disconnection when a session is considered to have ended. When a user reconnects after a disconnection, the user is connected to the same session and instance within this time interval.
refs.UpdateFleetRequest$MaxUserDurationInSeco: The maximum time during which a streaming session can run.
refs.UpdateFleetRequest$DisconnectTimeoutInSe: The time after disconnection when a session is considered to have ended. When the user reconnects after a disconnection, the user is connected to the same instance within this time interval.

LimitExceededException.base: The requested limit exceeds the permitted limit for an account.

refs.CreateStreamingURLRequest$Validity: The validity duration of the URL in seconds. After this duration, the URL returned by this operation becomes invalid.

refs.Image$Platform: The operating system platform of the image.

ResourceNotAvailableException.base: The specified resource exists and is not in use, but isn't available.

Session.base: Contains the parameters for a streaming session.

SessionState.base: Possible values for the state of a streaming session.

refs.Session$State: The current state of the streaming session.

refs.Application$DisplayName: The name of the application shown to the end users.
refs.Application$IconURL: The URL for the application icon. This URL may be time-limited.
refs.Application$LaunchPath: The path to the application executable in the instance.
refs.Application$LaunchParameters: A list of arguments that are passed to the application at launch.
refs.AssociateFleetRequest$FleetName: The name of the fleet to associate.
refs.AssociateFleetRequest$StackName: The name of the stack to which the fleet is associated.
refs.CreateFleetRequest$ImageName: Unique name of the image used by the fleet.
refs.CreateFleetRequest$InstanceType: The instance type of compute resources for the fleet. Fleet instances are launched from this instance type.
refs.CreateStreamingURLRequest$StackName: The stack for which the URL is generated.
refs.CreateStreamingURLRequest$FleetName: The fleet for which the URL is generated.
refs.CreateStreamingURLRequest$ApplicationId: The ID of the application that must be launched after the session starts.
refs.CreateStreamingURLResult$StreamingURL: The URL to start the AppStream 2.0 streaming session.
refs.DeleteFleetRequest$Name: The name of the fleet to be deleted.
refs.DeleteStackRequest$Name: The name of the stack to delete.
refs.DescribeFleetsRequest$NextToken: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If this value is null, it retrieves the first page.
refs.DescribeFleetsResult$NextToken: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If there are no more pages, this value is null.
refs.DescribeSessionsRequest$StackName: The name of the stack for which to list sessions.
refs.DescribeSessionsRequest$FleetName: The name of the fleet for which to list sessions.
refs.DescribeSessionsRequest$NextToken: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If this value is null, it retrieves the first page.
refs.DescribeSessionsResult$NextToken: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If there are no more pages, this value is null.
refs.DescribeStacksRequest$NextToken: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If this value is null, it retrieves the first page.
refs.DescribeStacksResult$NextToken: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If there are no more pages, this value is null.
refs.DisassociateFleetRequest$FleetName: The name of the fleet to disassociate.
refs.DisassociateFleetRequest$StackName: The name of the stack with which the fleet is associated.
refs.ExpireSessionRequest$SessionId: The unique identifier of the streaming session to be stopped.
refs.Fleet$DisplayName: The name displayed to end users on the AppStream 2.0 portal.
refs.Fleet$Description: The description displayed to end users on the AppStream 2.0 portal.
refs.Fleet$InstanceType: The instance type of compute resources for the fleet. The fleet instances are launched from this instance type.
refs.FleetError$ErrorMessage: The error message generated when the fleet has errors.
refs.ImageStateChangeReason$Message: The state change reason message to the end user.
refs.ListAssociatedFleetsRequest$StackName: The name of the stack whose associated fleets are listed.
refs.ListAssociatedFleetsRequest$NextToken: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If this value is null, it retrieves the first page.
refs.ListAssociatedFleetsResult$NextToken: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If there are no more pages, this value is null.
refs.ListAssociatedStacksRequest$FleetName: The name of the fleet whose associated stacks are listed.
refs.ListAssociatedStacksRequest$NextToken: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If this value is null, it retrieves the first page.
refs.ListAssociatedStacksResult$NextToken: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If there are no more pages, this value is null.
refs.Session$Id: The unique ID for a streaming session.
refs.Session$StackName: The name of the stack for which the streaming session was created.
refs.Session$FleetName: The name of the fleet for which the streaming session was created.
refs.StartFleetRequest$Name: The name of the fleet to start.
refs.StopFleetRequest$Name: The name of the fleet to stop.
refs.UpdateFleetRequest$ImageName: The image name from which a fleet is created.
refs.UpdateFleetRequest$InstanceType: The instance type of compute resources for the fleet. Fleet instances are launched from this instance type.
refs.UpdateStackRequest$Name: The name of the stack to update.

refs.DescribeFleetsRequest$Names: The fleet names to describe. Use null to describe all the fleets for the AWS account.
refs.DescribeImagesRequest$Names: A specific list of images to describe.
refs.DescribeStacksRequest$Names: The stack names to describe. Use null to describe all the stacks for the AWS account.

refs.VpcConfig$SubnetIds: The list of subnets to which a network interface is established from the fleet instance.

refs.CreateStreamingURLResult$Expires: Elapsed seconds after the Unix epoch, at which time this URL expires.
refs.Fleet$CreatedTime: The time at which the fleet was created.
refs.Image$CreatedTime: The timestamp when the image was created.
refs.Stack$CreatedTime: The timestamp when the stack was created.

refs.CreateStreamingURLRequest$UserId: A unique user ID for whom the URL is generated.
refs.DescribeSessionsRequest$UserId: The user for whom to list sessions. Use null to describe all the sessions for the stack and fleet.
refs.Session$UserId: The identifier of the user for whom the session was created.

refs.Image$Visibility: The visibility of an image to the user; images can be public or private.

VpcConfig.base: The VPC in which the fleet is launched.
